### Definition

A linear function $f(x)$ is one with the property

$$
f(ax_1 + bx_2) = af(x_1) + bf(x_2)
$$

### Problems

1. Prove that $f(x) = \beta x$ is linear.

$$
f(x) = \beta x
$$
$$
f(ax_1+bx_2) = \beta (ax_1+bx_2)
$$
$$
f(ax_1+bx_2) = a\beta x_1 + b\beta x_2 
$$
$$
f(ax_1+bx_2) = af(x_1) + bf(x_2) 
$$
$$
QED
$$

2. Prove that $f(x) = \beta_0 + \beta_1 x + \beta_2 x^2$ is *not* linear. 



$$
f(x) = \beta_0 + \beta_1 x + \beta_2 x^2
$$
$$
f'(x) = \beta_1 + \beta_2 *2x_2
$$
$$
f''(x)=  \beta_2 *2
$$
since $f''(x)$ is not equal to 0 therefor it is not linear. however the linearity is not determined by the predictor $x$ but rather the coefficient $\beta$, 


$$
f(\beta) = \beta_0 + \beta_1 x + \beta_2 x^2
$$
$$
f'(\beta) = 1 + x_1 + x^2_2
$$
$$
f''(\beta)= 0
$$
$$
QED
$$
